response.answer_text: A phenomenon, in a scientific context, is something that is observed to occur or to exist. Natural phenomena are those that occur or manifest without human input. Examples of natural phenomena include gravity, tides, biological processes and oscillation Visual phenomena include optical illusions, such as the peripheral drift illusion What is phenomenon? - Definition from WhatIs.com

What is original phenomenon? The original phenomena that underpins the Universe was postulated a couple of centuries ago. It takes the form of a quasi electric field the early scientists called Aether. Despite attempts to abandon the concept of Aether, it will be eventually found to be a logical physical description of the universal reality.
